ratings.comment: Excellent class. One of my favorites at UW.

Lectures can be a little dry sometimes, but if you show up and take good notes, you'll do good. If you go to lecture you don't need to read the book. 3 exams, non-cumulative. One 20-point quiz with extra credit opportunity. Very cute little old man that makes jokes every once in a while. Highly recommend this course and professor!

Really interesting material. He is a good lecturer and a nice guy. Long classes, but they are mostly worth it.  No textbook, and only 2 readings a week.  Shows lots of vacation photos.  Really easy grader. One semester-long journal, and two take home exams.

Awesome dude!  No textbook. Extremely easy. And I actually learned! He posts all slides online, don't really need to go to class. And lectures can be very long but they never go for the full time slot. TAKE THIS CLASS

One of my favorite professors at UW. He is extremely knowledgeable about the topic and very enthusiastic. He gives study guides for the exams, which are exhaustive, but if you take the time to fill them out and study it, you will do well on the exams. Take his class!!

Fun class. The way it's graded makes it super easy as long as you go to class (2 take homes and a diary each worth 1/3 of your grade). Sometimes it's interesting, sometimes not so much. No textbook and it's easy to get an A without doing the readings. Professor is very nice and passionate about European geography.

I thought that he was a wonderful instructor.  I will be honest here and say that the material is not the most exciting stuff out there, BUT he does keep your interest.  He is very willing to answer questions.  Be sure to attend lecture!  Overall, I would say a pretty lovely course.  Make for certain not to slack off on studying for exams :)

Though the lectures can get boring at times, the class is overall a pretty interesting one. He has a lot of interesting stories and information about his various travels and the topics covered. 3 Exams, mainly based on study guides and a map quiz. Pay attention, take notes or read the book and you'll do well.

Absolutely loved this class. Awesome professor with a true passion for what he's teaching. By far my favorite class at UW so far. Exams are easy if you do the study guides and go to lectures, which are really worth listening to. Really looking forward to taking 506 with him next semester.
Sweet man, interesting class. Study guides are very lengthy, but straight forward. Very lenient when grading exams and generous extra credits! Very passionate and knowledgable.

A very easy AB, work a little harder and it's definitely a fairly easy A. Book and lecture are the same, so pick one or the other, read the media articles (short 1-2 pages each) and you'll do well on the exams. Very easy extra credit opportunities as well!

Ostergren is awesome. There is no textbook, just interesting articles to read. You have class once a week, and he splits it up very well. Very interesting course, and amazing professor. You basically learn by viewing photos of his travels...Definitely recommended!!
Ostergren runs a very fair class. It's not an "easy A", but if you put enough time into memorizing the material, you can definitely get one. Lecture isn't mandatory, 3 exams, 1 quiz, no homework
Great class. Great professor. Interesting material covered. Not difficult to do well- just go to class and pay attention.
So easy, tests based on power points, don't have to go to lecture. Easy A

Easy,interesting class.  If you attend lecture and take notes of the bolded/highlighted things on his slides and do the readings, you will have no problem getting an A. A very interesting class and fun lectures to listen to and great slides( lots of pictures)!

As anyone else will tell you, this class is super boring. That said, the only work you'll ever have to do is study for each exam a few days in advance. It's an easy class once you get a grasp on the material. Next to impossible to take notes on everything he says so just pay attention and take it in.
Hard class, hard A, hard exams. DO NOT TAKE!
Great guy, but I thought the class was painfully boring - only rarely was there interesting stuff. Very easy B, an A isn't difficult but will take some work.

If you have some interest going in, attend class, and skim the readings you will get an A.  Three exams with study guide, one map quiz, and two extra credit opportunities.  Professor Ostergren was one of the most knowledgeable teachers I have ever had, and also told great stories!  A must if you have, or ever want to travel to Europe!

Great class, saw a lot of cool things in his power points. Very interesting subject, not always the best lecture but still enjoyable to see everything. He knows a ton and is clearly passionate. Easy to get an A if you follow the study guide and read the media readings.

I attended half the lectures and only studied the night before the exams and pulled off a B. Make sure to do the media readings as he always asks questions on them. Anything on the study guide is fair game, but only that content.

This was my favorite class this semester. Ostergren runs one of the fairest classes I've ever taken. If it was on his study guide, it was on his exam. The class can be dull but the subject is very interesting. He really knows what he's talking about and clearly enjoys it. It's easy to get an A, but there is a lot of memorization.

This class was really interesting. Ostergen really cares about the course, and it shows. He is excited every class. Even so, the lectures are a bit dry and it's easy to fall asleep. But, the lectures can also be really interesting, and there is a lot of stuff to learn. Memorize all obscure terms for tests---he likes to have you ID these.
Take this class with a friend. It's interesting, but VERY dry. Lots of cool pictures, but very easy to fall asleep... The best lectures were by the TA Kara, she has way more energy and was... louder!

As a professor he is very knowledgeable about Europe! I enjoyed his class greatly. Midterms easy as long as you study the study guide a few days in advance, and make sure you study for the map quiz (which will seem very overwhelming, but worth less than midterms w/ less material). Some slow days but still fun. Go to lecture or read, up to you.

This class is fun, interesting, and easy. He is very passionate and knowledgeable about Europe. He wrote the textbook, so it's basically the same as lecture material. The three exams are easy as long as you study the study guide. Everything on the exam is on the study guide. Multiple choice, matching, short answer on exams.
Fun,Easy,interesting class. I really enjoyed going to lecture, he smiles a lot and tells some good stories. Some days are slow, but the pictures are great! I recommend this class for everyone!
Great professor! Very organized, easy to follow. Makes lectures interesting. Easy, fun class.

Professor Ostergren is awesome. I simply can't imagine having a professor who is more knowledgeable and passionate about his subject. The class overall requires a lot of note taking (make sure to attend lecture) but his helpfulness and genuine concern for students makes his class enjoyable. If you have any interest in Europe, take this class

Great, adorable professor! The material is interesting, so it is easy to learn and pay attention. my advice: pay attention to detail and absorb information in lecture rather than scrambling to write it all down.

He is so passionate about his teaching. You really need to go to lecture because his slides are generally just pictures that he explains in great detail, and not everything is in the book. I read the whole book, but I don't know that reading it was necessary to do well. 3 exams & a quiz makes up your grade and if you study, you'll be fine!

Very interesting class that I highly recommend it for anyone looking to easily fit 3 credits into their schedule (2x a week).  As mentioned, it's basically just his personal accounts of trekking across Europe.  Prepare to be jealous.  Just make sure you know everything on the study guides for the exams.  He literally asks everything.

Easy A if you go to lecture and take notes.  Professor is the nicest person ever, gives every lecture with a smile on his face :) And it's cool just sitting back and looking at all his pictures.  Be warned, it will make you want to travel all over Europe!

Great professor and a great class. He knows so much about Europe and his classes are basically just pictures of his travels. Exams cover a lot of information but he gives a study guide with everything he expects you to know. Good stuff.

Interesting class and pretty easy.  However, it's too much like a high school class for my liking.  There is absolutely no critical thinking; he just crams the material and expects a simple fact regurgitation.  You'll get at LEAST an AB if you simply attend lecture and read the book.
Ostergren is a really great prof if you give him a chance, he does cover a lot of material, but gives out study guides with everything you need to know for each of the 3 tests

He's a very very nice guy. Likes to talk about his travels... lectures are basically looking at his pictures from his European vacations.  Study guides for the exam tell you everything to study. Pretty easy, you don't really have to go to lecture if you read the book: he wrote it.

This class is both easy and interesting.  For each test, he gives out a study guide with IDs and practice questions, most of which appear word for word on the exam.  If you are interested in this subject at all or if you need to fulfill and international studies requirement (like me), take this class and pad your GPA.

I loved this class!  I am not at all involved in a direct European studies major (I'm a zoo and bac major) and only took this class because it fit my schedule, fulfilled an I level course, and I've always had an interest in Europe.  This class has been one of my favorites!  Prof. Ostergren has awesome pictures, and awesome Europe stories.
